abstract: An attempt was made to use GEOS-C spacecraft height, as measured by the onboard radar altimeter, for an improved determination of the earth's gravitational field and for the determination of the variation of the physical surface of the oceans. Two tracking system approaches to accurately determine the spacecraft height (orbit) are described and their results stated. These are satellite-to-satellite tracking (SST) and ground-laser tracking (GLT). Height variations can be observed in the dm-regions using SST and in the m-region using present GLT.
title: Satellite height determination using satellite-to-satellite tracking and ground laser systems

publications.publicationName: NOAA  Sea Surface Topography from Space, Vol. 1

related.title: Sea Surface Topography from Space, Volume 1
